issue.status_text: 23-OCT-14: RP23-444F3 is completed sequence, HTGS phase 3 23-OCT-14: CH25-386B9 is completed sequence, HTGS phase 3 23-OCT-14: CH25-157P24 is completed sequence, HTGS phase 3 Accession for RP23-444F3: FO082315 Accession for CH25-157P24: FO907140 Accession for CH25-386B9: FO907141
issue.description: Part of Baalc (GeneID:118452, NM_080640.4) lies in the assembly gap between AC133654.4 and AC164883.5
There is a potential functional difference in the proteins encoded by RefSeq NM_133365.2 (Dnahc5) and the genomic region to which it aligns.
issue.resolution_text: The reference sequence is correct, an error is present in NM_133365.2, this will be corrected. Reviewing the paper corresponding to AF466704.1, is a prediction made from genomic sequence using homology to other dyneins. In addition to the 1 nt insert compared to the reference sequence the prediction also uses a non-consensus splice site for the adjacent exon, which compensates for the deletion. Correcting both, as found in the AK220406.1 transcript, maintains the expected reading frame.

issue.description: There is a difference in the RefSeq for Aard (GeneID:239435, NM_175503.3) and the genomic sequence to which it aligns.
issue.resolution_text: Switchpoint changed so that AC022775 is represented in the reference assembly. There are no discrepancies between NM_175503.3 and AC022775.

issue.description: There is a functional difference in the proteins encoded by 1700027J05Rik (GeneID:69440, NM_027081.3) and the sequence to which it aligns on the reference chromosome.
issue.resolution_text: PCR performed and an error found in the reference component AC160538. The PCR has been submitted to EMBL/GenBank accession FQ976556.1, this has been added to the TPF to correct the reference.

issue.status_text: 11-APR-14: RP23-4I22 has entered the sequencing pipeline Accession for RP23-4I22: FQ976815
issue.description: Possible assembly error or missing sequence from reference component AC101660.25; affects Muc19 (GeneID: 239611)

issue.summary: Should we retain MGSCv37 chr. 16 unlocalized scaffold NT_166325.1?
issue.description: CT486000.13, the sole component of Mm37 unlocalized contig NT_166325.1, may have had too much sequence trimmed in the last acc.ver update and may be incorrectly assigned to chr.16
issue.resolution_text: CT486000 is a component from chr15, it is wholly redundant under AC084384.1/AC084382.2 and will not be retained in future assembly versions.

issue.summary: Can WGS components of Mm37 chr. Un contig NT_166468 be moved to chr. 15?
issue.description: Alignments to Celera assembly suggest that WGS components from Mm37 chr.Un contig NT_166468 may belong on chr. 15
issue.resolution_text: Sequence blast of NT_166468.1 (CAAA01150319.1, CAAA01071840.1, CAAA01154103.1) shows 17.8kb alignment to AC225888.3 on chromosome 15, with the WGS contig extending into the gap between AC165106.5 and AC225888.3. The WGS components CAAA01150319.1, CAAA01071840.1 and CAAA01154103.1 have been added to the chr15 reference TPF.

issue.description: Krt85 (GeneID:53622, NM_016879.2) may be missing from Build 37.

issue.status_text: 24-AUG-11: RP24-270E8 is ready to enter the sequencing pipeline
issue.description: AC132893.23 contains Ugt3a1 (GeneID:105887), Gm2360 (GeneID:100039661), and Ugt3a2 (GeneID:223337). Gm2360 (NG_028998.1) at AC132893.23:69954..73226 is 100% identical to the 3' end of Ugt3a1, and the BAC has an 'unsure' region at this location with the note "unresolved tandem repeat: an estimated 3 copies of 7.2 kb" with some reported missing sequence. If there's really missing sequence, then it affects Gm2360 and the gene could be complete and protein-coding.
AC174724.3 removed from TPF since MGSCv37 and used as evidence to certficate the short join between AC140673.4 and AC156573.3
issue.resolution_text: AC174724.3 removed from TPF since MGSCv37 and used as evidence to certficate the short join between AC140673.4 and AC156573.3

issue.description: AC108837.8 updated to AC108837.9 since MGSCv37, reducing the length by 21,896bp.
issue.resolution_text: AC108837.8 updated to AC108837.9 since MGSCv37, reducing the length by 21,896bp. The WGS end extensions were removed from the clone ends.

issue.description: AC102262.9 updated to AC102262.10 since MGSCv37, adding 180bp of GA-rich repeat to the finished accession.
issue.resolution_text: AC102262.9 updated to AC102262.10 since MGSCv37, adding 180bp of GA-rich repeat to the finished accession.

issue.description: In progress

issue.summary: Issue reported from Web Site: Arsd absent from mouse assembly
issue.description: A user has reported that no homolog of ARSD is in the mouse reference genome assembly.
issue.resolution_text: PMID:11731500 indicates that ARSD and ARSE are absent in the mouse genome.

issue.summary: Fix patch for issue described in MG-3645
issue.description: There is a gap between the centromere and AC149294.8, this patch adds component FO082328.3 to the reference assembly providing ~29kb sequence to the gap.
issue.resolution_text: There is an assembly gap between the centromere and AC149294.8, originally described in MG-3645. This duplicate Jira issue is being used to manage an update at this gap that is being considered for patch release.

issue.summary: Fix patch for issue described in MG-3647
issue.description: There is a gap between AC133654.4 and AC164883.5, this patch adds component FO907141.2 to the reference assembly providing ~6.4kb sequence to the gap.
issue.resolution_text: There is an assembly gap between AC133654.4 and AC164883.5, originally described in MG-3647. This duplicate Jira issue is being used to manage an update at this gap that is being considered for patch release.

issue.summary: Fix patch for issue described in MG-3647
issue.description: There is a gap between AC133654.4 and AC164883.5, this patch adds component FO082315.3 to the reference assembly providing ~9kb sequence to the gap.
issue.resolution_text: There is an assembly gap between AC133654.4 and AC164883.5, originally described in MG-3647. This duplicate Jira issue is being used to manage an update at this gap that is being considered for patch release.

issue.status_text: RP23-92M9 spans the gap between AC165106 and AC225888 in which this WGS contig places.
issue.description: There are sequence discrepancies in the alignment of RefSeq NM_009268.1 (Spt2) to the unplaced (Chr. Un) reference component CAAA01154103.1; these may be caused by intervariation.
